briefdescription.para: Callback type for fill-mode replica construction.

parameterdescription.para: Destination buffer for the replica (first-touched for locality).

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno-like value on failure.

briefdescription.para: First-touch a writable buffer to bias NUMA page placement.

detaileddescription.para: Writes one byte per cache line across the region so the kernel maps resident pages to the NUMA node for the current CPU affinity.

briefdescription.para: Best-effort hint that the region will be needed soon.

detaileddescription.para: Uses posix_madvise/madvise when available. Degrades to a no-op otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Best-effort hint that the region will be accessed sequentially.
Allocate a replica buffer and establish locality via first-touch.

simplesect.para: Pointer to allocated memory, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Free all allocations owned by a replica set.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_topology_t *topo, int n_sockets, const void *blob, size_t blob_size, ie_hot_replicas_t **out)
memberdef.name: ie_hot_replicate_build

briefdescription.para: Create per-socket replicas of an existing blob using memcpy (copy mode).

detaileddescription.para: For each socket: 1) Bind to that socket via ie_topology_bind_thread_to_socket(). 2) Allocate replica memory and first-touch it to establish locality. 3) memcpy() the source blob into the local replica. 4) Provide best-effort paging hints to the OS.

parameterdescription.para: Topology handle (non-NULL recommended; if NULL, binding is skipped).
Desired number of sockets; if <= 0, derived from topo or defaults to 1 if unknown.
Output pointer for the replicas object (non-NULL).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; negative errno-like code on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_topology_t *topo, int n_sockets, size_t replica_size, ie_hot_replica_fill_fn fill, void *user, ie_hot_replicas_t **out)
memberdef.name: ie_hot_replicate_build_fill

briefdescription.para: Create per-socket replicas using a user callback to fill them (fill mode).

detaileddescription.para: Preferred for runtime reconstruction: each replica is constructed in-place on its socket after first-touch to avoid cross-socket memcpy bandwidth.

For each socket: 1) Bind to that socket via ie_topology_bind_thread_to_socket(). 2) Allocate replica memory and first-touch it to establish locality. 3) Invoke fill(socket_id, replica_ptr, replica_size, user). 4) Provide best-effort paging hints to the OS.

parameterdescription.para: Topology handle (non-NULL recommended; if NULL, binding is skipped).
Desired number of sockets; if <= 0, derived from topo or defaults to 1 if unknown.
Size in bytes of each replica (> 0).
Callback to populate each per-socket replica (non-NULL).
Opaque user pointer passed to fill.
Output pointer for the replicas object (non-NULL).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; negative errno-like code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Free replicas previously built by the build functions.
Retrieve the replica pointer for a specific socket.

parameterdescription.para: Optional return for replica size; may be NULL.

simplesect.para: Pointer to replica memory or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Convenience API: memcpy into a given socketâ€™s replica.

detaileddescription.para: Copies exactly the size of the existing replica buffer for socket_id.

parameterdescription.para: Source bytes (non-NULL). Must be at least replica size.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; -EINVAL on bad args; -ENOBUFS if replica size is zero.

briefdescription.para: Replication of hot weight blobs per socket using first-touch placement.

detaileddescription.para: This module provides utilities to create per-socket replicas of a contiguous "hot" blob so the inference kernel can read memory local to each socket when worker threads are socket-pinned.

Two build modes are supported: 1) Copy mode: replicate an existing source blob via memcpy(). 2) Fill mode: allocate per-socket memory, first-touch it, then let a caller-provided callback populate the replica in-place (preferred for runtime reconstruction paths to avoid cross-socket copies).
Thread pinning is delegated to the topology layer via ie_topology_bind_thread_to_socket(). This compilation unit does not implement pinning itself.
